intro: Asterostigma tweedieanum, commonly known as the Tweedie's asterostigma, is a rare and little-known plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellowish to brownish discoid flowers, which are typically clustered in small, compact heads. The plant is native to specific regions of South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered with fine hairs, and it produces small, inconspicuous bracts beneath the flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
